name: .38 Special
description:
'''38 Special''', often stylized as '''.38 Special''' or spelled out as '''Thirty-eight Special''', is an American [[rock music|rock]] band formed in [[Jacksonville, Florida]], in 1974 by singer-guitarists [[Donnie Van Zant|Donald Newton "Donnie" Van Zant]] (born June 11, 1952) and [[Don Barnes|Richard Donald "Don" Barnes]] (born December 3, 1952).

They are known for their hit songs including "[[Hold On Loosely]]" and "[[Caught Up in You]]" among various other [[top 40]] hits on the US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] during the 1980s and early 1990s. The other songs include "[[Fantasy Girl]]", "[[Rockin' into the Night (song)|Rockin' into the Night]]", "[[You Keep Runnin' Away]]", "[[If I'd Been the One]]", "[[Back Where You Belong]]", "[[Teacher, Teacher (38 Special song)|Teacher, Teacher]]", "[[Like No Other Night]]", "[[Second Chance (38 Special song)|Second Chance]]", and "[[The Sound of Your Voice]]".
